title: Update `teloxide-core` `0.4.5` -> `0.5.0`
body: uwu

title: Implement concurrent update dispatching
body:
After some hot fucking with `Arc`s, `Box`es, `async`, closures, `Deref`s, and `move`s, I was finally able to implement concurrent handling in the new `Dispatcher`.

I think we can release v0.8.0 after this PR is merged and postpone all the other v0.8.0 issues/PRs.

Related to https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/571.
Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/536.

title: Fix dispatcher's graceful shutdown
body:
Related to https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/571.

Please review the changes commit-by-commit, I tried to separate big diffs as much as possible, thank you.

title: Implement `Dialogue::chat_id`
body: Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/579.

title: Remove the need for `CacheMe` in dispatcher
body:
<!--
Before making this PR, please ensure the following:

 - The PR is open to `dev`, NOT `master`.
 - `CHANGELOG.md` is updated (if necessary).
 - Documentation and tests are updated (if necessary).
-->
Doesn't change anything for users, just an internal cleanup.

title: change the link and wording about the vuln in the readme
body: (pr is intentionally agains master)

title: Release `0.7.3`
body:
Prepare a `0.7.3` release with updated `teloxide-core` to bring in the [security fix].

[security fix]: https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-core/pull/200

title: Implement `teloxide::handler!`
body: Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/567.

title: Pin `nightly-2022-01-17` in the CI
body: See https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/pull/566#issuecomment-1077539269.

title: Require that `UpdateListener::StopToken` is `Send`
body:
<!--
Before making this PR, please ensure the following:

 - The PR is open to `dev`, NOT `master`.
 - `CHANGELOG.md` is updated (if necessary).
 - Documentation and tests are updated (if necessary).
-->

Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/553

title: Document and test all command renaming rules
Create `pull_request_template.md`
body: Closes https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/476.

title: Disable `repls2` unhandled update warnings
body: Closes https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/557.

title: Deprecate `enable_logging!` in favour of configuring logging yourself
body:
`enable_logging!` is confusing and in code seems like "magic" even though it really just calls into `pretty_env_logger`.
IMO initialising logging is a better way to enable logging.

title: Log `UpdateKind::Error` in `dispatching2`
body: Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/551.

title: Implement `ErasedStorage`
body: Needed for https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/pull/546.

title: Built-in webhook support
body: Add built-in support for webhooks

title: Correct open issue suggestion
body: We track all issues in `teloxide` repo (the `-core` one doesn't even have issues turned on).

title: Refactor `BotCommand` trait & related stuff
body:
1. Rename `BotCommand` -> `BotCommands`
2. Implement  #531 (closes #531)
3. Some unrelated documentation/test/readme/changelog fixes

Note that this PR also requires changes from https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-macros/pull/15

title: Merge `examples/sqlite_remember.rs` with `redis_remember.rs`
body: Closes https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/504.

title: Fix compilation with non-default features
body:
When introducing dispatching v2 we've somehow lost the fact that `repl`s require `ctrlc_handler`, so without default features the compilation failed. Basically we've reintroduced issue #462.

Also we've introduced a similar bug with `cache-me` feature that is required by `dispatching2` feature but wasn't declared as such.

title: 🧹 fix case sensitive
body:
- Change parameter name from `bot_name` to `bot_username` in [`parse_command`](https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/blob/727edeae1cebde27a5a2136be192921bf6217705/src/utils/command.rs#L296) and [`parse_command_with_prefix`](https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/blob/727edeae1cebde27a5a2136be192921bf6217705/src/utils/command.rs#L324)
- Fix case sensitive of `bot_username`
- Add test


### Fix this issue
```rust
let result = parse_command("/ban@MyNameBot1 3 hours", "mynamebot1");
assert!(result.is_none());
```

title: Fix the unintentional bracket in the docs badge url
Fixed broken example links on the Readme
Remove `doc(cfg)` annotations in favour of `feature(doc_auto_cfg)`
body: Just some internal changes to make code nicer (and maybe also fix docs for places where we've forgot to add `doc(cfg)`)

title: Make the default and error handlers `Send + Sync`
body:
Reduces the pain in the ass when trying to use the dispatcher in `tokio::spawn` or similar.
Discussion: https://t.me/teloxide/6529.

title: Update the version in the README
Release v0.6.0
body: `cargo publish --dry-run` performs well.

title: Post dispatching2
cleanup update listeners docs
body:
- Cleanup `update_listeners` docs - Clarify `StatefulListener` docs a little For reference, the diagram looks like this:
Big picture

![2022-01-25_20-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38225716/151029719-e174de0a-2259-4809-9ed3-64d4b98f6f12.png)

title: Do not retry `get_updates` infinitely while stopping polling listener
body: Fixes #496

title: Remove "rustc version" from issue templates
body: There wasn't even a single time rustc version mattered in our issues.

title: Update `teloxide-core` to the latest git version
body: This, among over things, allows to test fixes made in `teloxide-core` since the last release

title: Remove the `authors` field from `Cargo.toml`
body: See https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-core/pull/148#issuecomment-998751346.

title: crates.io no longer shows badges
body:
[crates.io](https://crates.io) previously displayed badges next to a crate on its website, but that functionality has been removed. Packages should place badges in its README file which will be displayed on [crates.io](https://crates.io) (see [the `readme` field](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-readme-field)).

From note at [Cargo Manifest Format](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-badges-section)

title: fix example's Cargo.toml
body: It's a one-line change but it took me quite a while to figure out that the feature was missing on cargo.toml

title: Dispatching 2.0
Pin tooling in the CI to a specific version
body: Both Clippy and Rustfmt are pinned to the current latest version (2021-10-24)

title: Fix compilation without ctrlc_handler feature
body:
The feature gate is moved to the `dispatching` mod level.
Public exports are also covered by this flag now.

Closes #462

title: Improve `buttons` example
body:
- Use `message.chat.id`, instead of passing it via callback data
- Use a better layout for buttons
- Propagete errors in callback_handler, handle messages without text
- Add inline support

Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/459

title: Add example using the InlineKeyboardMarkup
body:
Hi all :wave: 

This is an example of how you can use the `InlineKeyboardMarkup` to create a more complex bot with buttons and callbacks to handle those clicks.﻿

title: Use a shorter description for a nice look
body: Without wrapping the description to the next line

title: Add `wa7sa34cx/the-black-box-bot` to the community bots
body: Additionally, change the order of terms of functionality/usefulness, fix some consistency issues, and remove `msfjarvis/walls-bot-rs` because it's just a private bot.

title: Add `auto-send` to the list of default features
body: We use this feature in basically every example and we expect everyone to use it, so I think it should be on by default. Also, users had problems b/c they forgot to turn it on.

title: updated README.md to push example project
body: updated README.md to be in pair with teloxide dependencies

title: Require that `AsUpdateStream::Stream` is `Send`
body: inspired by this question: https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/discussions/431

title: Update README.md with PowerShell command
body: Does this look better? Edit it to your liking.

title: Depend on a right `futures` version
body: Currently, users are having problems because of older `futures` versions locked in their `Cargo.lock`.

title: Add cyberknight777/knight-bot to community bots
body: Signed-off-by: Cyber Knight <cyberknight755@gmail.com>

title: Include inline bot example
body:
Hello :wave: 

I started using your library to develop a bot that requires inline functionality. I found #207 but also found that the example given there wasn't compiling, so I poked around until I was able to come up with something that did.

Hopefully this is helpful and that I didn't miss anything obvious in the contributions guidelines.

title: Update the v0.5.1 release date
body: Very big PR, please take your time and review it carefully.

title: Improve log messages when `^C` is received with `^C` handler setted up
body:
Now they tell the user to not repeatedly press `^C` since only the first signal actually does anything, all subsequent ones are ignored.

Before:
![2021-07-21_15-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38225716/126491918-01c3fd77-a42c-4e28-90f8-2083ca281ae5.png)

After:
![2021-07-21_15-45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38225716/126491938-6543c664-c05d-48fb-9ab3-e15d349b4d53.png)
